Posts.Content: Sep 29, 2009 08:46PM - edited Sep 29, 2009 08:50PM by mossybaby Just had mine off on Sept 18th and I feel the same way.  I have never been one to wallow in self pity but man oh man has this disease just opened my doors!!   I also keep telling myself "patience is a virtue" but I can't seem to live by that motto.    Since I'm separated, I feel like I won't ever get intimate with anyone again.  At least not for a very very very long time.  I do like the advice on what to do when it all happens though.  It is great to have a community of people here who have the same questions and can help with the answers!!
Posts.Title: I need help in the bedroom - any advice? Asterix1234 TaminMo

Posts.Content: Jun 7, 2010 11:11PM mossybaby wrote: Hello.  When I was 17 my mother passed away from a 5 year fight with ovarian cancer.  I'm on here now battling a different kind which makes remembering all those tough years pretty hard.  My best advice would be to be there holding her hand every moment you get.  I was a teen and ran from it mostly which I regret.  Thank God for hospice and their excellent care at the end.  I know I couldn't have been there with out them.  Now over 15 years later, I still remember all the wonderful times and fun we had together.  I know with every part of my being she has transformed into an angel or energy or spirit free of pain and full of love and happiness.  Lots of Love to you & your friend during this difficult journey.  Yvonne
Posts.Title: Watching a friend die...so hard. pee Honeybear

Posts.Content: Dec 15, 2009 01:10AM mossybaby wrote: This is the hurdle I just can't get over.  My girls are young 6  & 4 and  I just don;t know what to say to them about all of this cancer sh*t.  I went to a psychologist who said not to talk about death or things like that since they will just worry about it more but how do you prepare them for mommy might not be here anymore.  I know what you are going through because this is the only subject I cry over constantly.   FUDGE U cancer!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Posts.Title: It just doesn't get easy does it??? Fitztwins Fitztwins

Posts.Content: mossybaby wrote: Not sure where to start.  I haven't dared to come on to this site after my doctor said my scans were clear about five months ago.  I was hoping it was all over and like a bad dream it would all go away. But I guess that's not in the cards just yet.  Another reoccurance :(  Lymph nodes in my chest and neck are lighting up now.   It's odd though how in that time frame, all the old friends who came to my side have quickly disappeared back into the woodwork.   I'm finding myself sad and alone all over again.  I know everyone has busy lives and I tend to lose touch too but right now I feel like I really need a friend and I have no one to turn to.  Not sure what else to say.. I'm just feeling very lost right now. Thanks for listening or pointing me to the right place.  Love Health and happiness to all of you - Yvonne Yvonne Dx 4/2009, IBC, 6cm+, Stage IV, 11/12 nodes, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Apr 8, 2011 11:59PM mossybaby wrote: Thank you for being out there.  Sometimes it's just good to hear that we are not alone. Everyone on this sight gives me courage and strength.
Posts.Title: In need of a friend mossybaby chainsawz

Posts.Content: Apr 9, 2011 11:07PM mossybaby wrote: Thank you everyone for helping me to find some light.  Your courage and strength give me hope that maybe I can make it through another round of rads and chemo.   I'm trying to let go the anger and disappointment in myself, this diesease, and the world so I can move ahead with a strong positive attitude.  I know with you all my my side, I have a much better chance.
Posts.Title: In need of a friend mossybaby chainsawz

Posts.Content: Apr 20, 2011 11:18PM mossybaby wrote: Friends have found me again which has been a blessing in the past 2 weeks.  Things not well thouggh with brain mets waanting a shot a me.    We are going to get through this tthough.  I will notstop fighting!!!!!!!!!!!!! HOPE and LOVE  yvnne
Posts.Title: In need of a friend mossybaby chainsawz

Posts.Content: mossybaby wrote: So  here I am again questioning these Drs & their choices. Previously,   I was  diaganosed with mets to my mast site  as  well as to various lymph nodes through out  my body.     After that, the local rad dr & my dr  agreeded the PARP clinical trial would  be my best bet.       Well 2 weeks later, the trial people don't think the amount of spread of the disease is enough to be on the study. WHAT THE F#$%!!    Apparantly 1 foot in the ground isn't good enough. I have to be in the hole with them shoveling dirt on me before they will help!!!    Their suggestion........ wait for another month or 2 without any treatment to see how bad it can get then get rescanned to see if I'm bad enough to qualify.  I seriously don't know which way to turn here. ANY advice at all on what options are out there would be appreciated.  I already had TAC & Xeloda Ixempra combos.  HAs anyone  done      radiation with chemo together.  Are there more choices QQQQQQQQ Yvonne Dx 4/2009, IBC, 6cm+, Stage IV, 11/12 nodes, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Choices - Chemo or Clinical Trial mossybaby Reneepals

Posts.Content: mossybaby wrote: Hello - today I was given the "get your affairs in order talk" by my doctors.  Pet scan showed that what I though was a local reoccurance on the skin was not the case.  I have mets to the lymp nodes in the middle of my chest and to the ones by my liver.  Docs don't like to give a time frame because "miracles" can happen and I guess they are going to search for a clinical trial somewhere but the one I trust most said she hasn't talked to God today but by the progression thus far I may not see next Christmas.  I am of course utterly devastated and don't know how to proceed from here.  Head is still spinning from it all.   STUPID CANCER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Yvonne Dx 4/2009, IBC, 6cm+, Stage IV, 11/12 nodes, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: The "get your affairs in order" talk mossybaby RobinWendy

Posts.Content: Dec 11, 2009 12:56PM mossybaby wrote: Thank you lovely ladies for the help & hope you give.  I will be heading back to the Univ of PA on Dec 21 for another look at the place I'm at.  My particular tumor seems to be quite the bugger.  It has continuosly stuck it's nose up at the chemo's I have been on TAC first ,now 3/4 of the way through Ixempra & Xeloda.  Radiation doc had me all marked up and reay to go for that but has now said he won't proceed because it won't help and he wants me on more chemo.  I'm feeling quite defeated since chemo seems to be the answer yet my body refuses to respond to it.  I truly do hope I can get into a clinical trial and I agree completely that the docs shouldn't just send you home without a game plan.  I guess they need time to look around for options but I feel like I'm falling behind because of the delays.  As for the rest of it, I am going to spend this weekend getting everything in order so I don't have to think it about it after that.  Will is being drawn up, trusts being set up for my beautiful princesses and all those things that I have been avoiding because it felt like giving up.  After I take care of this, I'm not spending another moment obsessing over this thing (easier said then done is right!!) Lots of love & happiness to everyone - Yvonne
Posts.Title: The "get your affairs in order" talk mossybaby RobinWendy
